required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 2, Pharmacokinetics Study of Eltrombopag in Japanese Thrombocytopenic Subjects With Chronic Liver Disease
clinical_study.official_title: TPL111913, a Multi-centre, Open Label, Dose Ranging Phase II Study to Assess Efficacy, Safety and Pharmacokinetics of Eltrombopag in Japanese Thrombocytopenic Subjects With Chronic Liver Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open label, multi-centre, dose ranging study to assess efficacy, safety and pharmacokinetics of eltrombopag in thrombocytopenic subjects with chronic liver disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Platelet Counts on Day 15
primary_outcome.description: Platelet counts were measured by blood draw. Change from Baseline was calculated as the Day 15 value minus the Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of Covariance for Three Patterns of Dose Response Using the Change From Baseline in Platelet Counts (Baseline Platelet Counts as Covariate)
secondary_outcome.description: Exploratory analysis was conducted to see a dose response/trend when a dose goes high with the changes from baseline in platelet counts (12.5 mg, 25 mg, and 37.5 mg) on Day 15 of each subject. The data were analyzed with baseline of platelet counts as covariate for the following dose response pattern using contrast: (1) linearity, (2) saturation at the medium dose, (3) onset of response at the high dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of Covariance for Three Patterns of Dose Response Using the Change From Baseline in Platelet Counts (Baseline of Platelet Counts and Child-Pugh Class as Covariates)
secondary_outcome.description: Exploratory analysis was conducted to see a dose response/trend when a dose goes high with the changes from baseline in platelet counts (12.5 mg, 25 mg, and 37.5 mg) on Day 15 of each subject. The data were analyzed with baseline of platelet counts and Child-Pugh class as covariate for the following dose response pattern using contrast: (1) linearity, (2) saturation at the medium dose, (3) onset of response at the high dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Platelet Counts on Day 15
secondary_outcome.description: Platelet counts were measured by blood draw. Change from Baseline was calculated as the Day 15 value minus the Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Baseline), Day 8, Day 15, and Final Assessment Point (Day 15 or Day 22)
secondary_outcome.description: Platelet counts were measured by blood draw. The Final Assessment Point is the last visit during the treatment period, which is Day 15 or Day 22.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days post-treatment, 8 days post-treatment, and 15 days post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Platelet counts were measured by blood draw.
Platelet counts were measured by blood draw. The Final Assessment Point is the last visit during the treatment period, which is Day 15 or Day 22.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Platelet Counts by Treatment Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 8, Day 15, and Final Assessment Point (Day 15 or Day 22)
secondary_outcome.description: Platelet counts were measured by blood draw. The Final Assessment Point is the last visit during the treatment period, which is Day 15 or Day 22. Change from Baseline was calculated as the value at each visit minus the Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Platelet Counts by Post-Treatment Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days post-treatment, 8 days post-treatment, and 15 days post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Platelet counts were measured by blood draw. Change from Baseline was calculated as the value at each visit minus the Baseline value.
A responder was defined as a participant with a platelet count within the target range (>=80 x 10^9/Liter) on Day 15.

A responder was defined as a participant with a platelet count within the target range (>=80 x 10^9/Liter) on Day 22 after receiving eltrombopag for an additional week from Day 15, on which his or her platelet count was <80 x 10^9/Liter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Platelet Counts on Day 15 by Child-Pugh Class
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline was calculated as the Day 15 value minus the Baseline value. The Child-Pugh (CP) score (ranging from 5 to 15, with 5 being mild and 15 being severe), calculated based on total bilirubin, serum albumin, international normalized ratio, ascites, and hepatic encephalopathy, is used to assess the severity of liver disease. A CP score of 5 or 6 is classified as Class A (mild), a score of 7-9 is classified as Class B (moderate), and a score >=10 is classified as Class C (severe). Participants with a CP score <10 were enrolled in the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Platelet Counts on Day 15 by Sex
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline was calculated as the Day 15 value minus the Baseline value. The numbers of females and males in each treatment group are illustrated by the "n's" in the category titles.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Platelet Counts on Day 15 by Age
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline was calculated as the Day 15 value minus the Baseline value. The numbers of participants in each age category are illustrated by the "n's" in the category titles.

secondary_outcome.measure: Log-transformed Cmax on Days 14 and 15 in Participants Receiving Eltrombopag 12.5 mg
secondary_outcome.description: Serial PK samples were collected over a 24-hour (h) period on Days 14 and 15 in participants receiving eltrombopag 12.5 mg. A total of 8 blood samples (3 milliliters per sample) were collected at pre-dose, and at 1 h, 2 h, 4 h, 6 h, 8 h, 10 h, and 24 h post-dose. Cmax=maximum drug concentration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Log-transformed Tmax on Days 14 and 15 in Participants Receiving Eltrombopag 12.5 mg
secondary_outcome.description: Serial PK samples were collected over a 24-hour (h) period on Days 14 and 15 in participants receiving eltrombopag 12.5 mg. A total of 8 blood samples (3 milliliters per sample) were collected at pre-dose, and at 1 h, 2 h, 4 h, 6 h, 8 h, 10 h, and 24 h post-dose. Tmax=maximum drug concentration time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Log-transformed AUC(0-t) and AUC(0-24) on Days 14 and 15 in Participants Receiving Eltrombopag 12.5 mg
secondary_outcome.description: Serial PK samples were collected over a 24-hour (h) period on Days 14 and 15 in participants receiving eltrombopag 12.5 mg. A total of 8 blood samples (3 milliliters per sample) were collected at pre-dose, and at 1 h, 2 h, 4 h, 6 h, 8 h, 10 h, and 24 h post-dose. AUC(0-t)=area under the concentration-time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to last time of quantifiable concentration, and AUC(0-24)=area under the concentration-time curve from 0 (pre-dose) to 24 hours.

intervention.description: eltrombopag 12.5 mg tablet once a day
eltrombopag 25 mg tablet once a day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject who agree to comply with protocol requirements and instructions and who provide signed and dated written informed consent.
- Male and female subjects, ≥20 years of age (at the time of informed consent) with chronic liver disease.
- Child-Pugh score <=9.
- A baseline platelet count <50,000/mcL.
- A baseline serum sodium level >130 mEq/L.
- Haemoglobin concentration >8 g/dL, stable for at least 4 weeks.
- A female is eligible to enter and participate in the study if she is of:
Non-childbearing potential (i.e., physiologically incapable of becoming pregnant) including any female who:
- Has had a hysterectomy
- Has had a bilateral oophorectomy (ovariectomy)
- Has had a bilateral tubal ligation
- Is post-menopausal (demonstrate total cessation of menses for longer than one year)
Childbearing potential, has a negative urine and/or serum pregnancy test at screening, and within the 24 hour period prior to the first dose of investigational product and uses one of the following acceptable methods of contraception:
- Complete abstinence from intercourse.
- Any intrauterine device (IUD) with a documented failure rate of less than 1% per year.
- Double-barrier contraception (condom with spermicidal jelly, or diaphragm with spermicide).
- Male partner who is sterile (diagnosed by a qualified medical professional) prior to the female subject's study entry and is the sole sexual partner for that female.
- Oral contraceptive (combined).
- Subject has no physical limitation to ingest and retain oral medication.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with known or suspected hypersensitivity, intolerance or allergy to any of the ingredients in eltrombopag tablets.
- Evidence of portal vein thrombosis on abdominal imaging (ultrasound with Doppler or appropriate magnetic resonance imaging/computed tomography (MRI/CT) imaging techniques) within 3 months before the start of the study.
- History of arterial or venous thrombosis (including Budd-Chiari Syndrome),
AND ≥ two of the following risk factors:
- hereditary thrombophilic disorders (e.g. antithrombinIII (ATIII) deficiency, etc.)
- hormone replacement therapy
- systemic contraception therapy (containing oestrogen)
- smoking
- diabetes
- hypercholesterolemia
- medication for hypertension or cancer
- Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) infection.
- History of drug/alcohol abuse or dependence within 1 year prior to screening.
- Any disease condition associated with current active World Health Organization (WHO) Grade 3 or 4 bleeding.
- Active infection requiring systemic antibiotic therapy.
- Pregnant, nursing mothers, women who may be pregnant, or women who plan to become pregnant during the time of study participation.
- Treatment with platelet transfusion within 2 weeks prior to Day 1.
- Treatment with interferon within 4 weeks prior to Day 1.
- Treatment with an investigational drug within 30 days or five half-lives (whichever is longer) preceding the first dose of study medication.
- History of platelet agglutination abnormality.
- History of porphyria.
- Subjects who are deemed unsuitable for the study by the investigator (or subinvestigator).

reference.citation: Kawaguchi T, Komori A, Seike M, Fujiyama S, Watanabe H, Tanaka M, Sakisaka S, Nakamuta M, Sasaki Y, Oketani M, Hattori T, Katsura K, Sata M. Efficacy and safety of eltrombopag in Japanese patients with chronic liver disease and thrombocytopenia: a randomized, open-label, phase II study. J Gastroenterol. 2012 Dec;47(12):1342-51. doi: 10.1007/s00535-012-0600-5. Epub 2012 Jun 8.

group.title: Eltrombopag 12.5 mg
group.description: Participants received 12.5 milligrams (mg) of eltrombopag once daily for 14 days.

group.title: Eltrombopag 25 mg
group.description: Participants received 25 mg of eltrombopag once daily for 14 days. Participants with a platelet count <80 x 10^9/Liter on Day 15 received eltrombopag for an additional week if the participant agreed to it and the investigator considered it appropriate.

group.title: Eltrombopag 37.5 mg
group.description: Participants received 37.5 mg of eltrombopag once daily for 14 days. Participants with a platelet count <80 x 10^9/Liter on Day 15 received eltrombopag for an additional week if the participant agreed to it and the investigator considered it appropriate.

group.description: Participants received 37.5 mg of eltrombopag once daily for 14 days. Participants with a platelet count <80 x 10^9/Liter on Day 15 received eltrombopag for an additional week if the participant agreed to it and the investigator considered it appropriate.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Number of participants categorized into the indicated Child-Pugh (CP) Class
measure.description: The CP score (ranging from 5 to 15, with 5 being mild and 15 being severe), calculated based on total bilirubin, serum albumin, international normalized ratio, ascites, and hepatic encephalopathy, is used to assess the severity of liver disease. A CP score of 5 or 6 is classified as Class A (mild), a score of 7-9 is classified as Class B (moderate), and a score >=10 is classified as Class C (severe). Participants with a CP score <10 were enrolled in the study

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Platelet Counts on Day 15
outcome.description: Platelet counts were measured by blood draw. Change from Baseline was calculated as the Day 15 value minus the Baseline value.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): all enrolled participants, excluding those who received no doses of eltrombopag during the treatment period, those without a baseline platelet assessment, and those without at least one on-therapy (scheduled or unscheduled) platelet assessment.

outcome.title: Analysis of Covariance for Three Patterns of Dose Response Using the Change From Baseline in Platelet Counts (Baseline Platelet Counts as Covariate)
outcome.description: Exploratory analysis was conducted to see a dose response/trend when a dose goes high with the changes from baseline in platelet counts (12.5 mg, 25 mg, and 37.5 mg) on Day 15 of each subject. The data were analyzed with baseline of platelet counts as covariate for the following dose response pattern using contrast: (1) linearity, (2) saturation at the medium dose, (3) onset of response at the high dose.

measure.description: Exploratory analysis was conducted to see a dose response/trend when a dose goes high with the changes from baseline in platelet counts (12.5 mg, 25 mg, and 37.5 mg) on Day 15 of each subject. The data were analyzed with baseline of platelet counts as covariate for the following dose response pattern using contrast: (1) linearity, (2) saturation at the medium dose, (3) onset of response at the high dose.

analysis.p_value_desc: Linearity. This analysis is based on each participants' change in platelet count.
analysis.method_desc: No adjustment for multiplicity was made because this analysis was exploratory.

analysis.p_value_desc: Saturation at the medium dose. This analysis is based on each participants' change in platelet count.
analysis.method_desc: No adjustment for multiplicity was made because this analysis was exploratory.

analysis.p_value_desc: Onset of response at the higher dose. This analysis is based on each participants' change in platelet count.
analysis.method_desc: No adjustment for multiplicity was made because this analysis was exploratory.

outcome.title: Platelet Counts by Treatment Visit
outcome.description: Platelet counts were measured by blood draw. The Final Assessment Point is the last visit during the treatment period, which is Day 15 or Day 22.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Baseline), Day 8, Day 15, and Final Assessment Point (Day 15 or Day 22)
outcome.population: FAS. The number of participants analyzed varies by visit, because the platelet count data on 4 days post-treatment in one participant in the 37.5 mg group are missing and the platelet count data post-specific therapies affecting the evaluation of efficacy are excluded from this efficacy analysis.

outcome.title: Platelet Counts at Day 22
outcome.description: Platelet counts were measured by blood draw. The Final Assessment Point is the last visit during the treatment period, which is Day 15 or Day 22.
outcome.population: FAS. Participants in the 12.5 mg group have no data on Day 22 because they received the medication for only 14 days. Only 6 participants in the 25 mg group and 2 participants in the 37.5 mg group received the medication for an additional week, because they had a platelet count <80 x 10^9/Liter on Day 15.

group.description: Participants received 37.5 mg of eltrombopag once daily for 14 days. Participants with a platelet count <80 x 10^9/Liter on Day 15 received eltrombopag for an additional week if the participant agreed to it and the investigator considered it appropriate.

measure.title: Percentage of Responders on Day 22
measure.description: A responder was defined as a participant with a platelet count within the target range (>=80 x 10^9/Liter) on Day 22 after receiving eltrombopag for an additional week from Day 15, on which his or her platelet count was <80 x 10^9/Liter.
measure.population: FAS. Participants in the 12.5 mg group have no data on Day 22 because they received the medication for only 14 days. Only 6 participants in the 25 mg group and 2 participants in the 37.5 mg group received the medication for an additional week, because they had a platelet count <80 x 10^9/Liter on Day 15.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Platelet Counts on Day 15 by Child-Pugh Class
outcome.description: Change from Baseline was calculated as the Day 15 value minus the Baseline value. The Child-Pugh (CP) score (ranging from 5 to 15, with 5 being mild and 15 being severe), calculated based on total bilirubin, serum albumin, international normalized ratio, ascites, and hepatic encephalopathy, is used to assess the severity of liver disease. A CP score of 5 or 6 is classified as Class A (mild), a score of 7-9 is classified as Class B (moderate), and a score >=10 is classified as Class C (severe). Participants with a CP score <10 were enrolled in the study.
outcome.population: FAS. The number of participants categorized as Class A or Class B is given in the category titles.

group.title: Eltrombopag 12.5 mg
group.description: Participants received 12.5 milligrams (mg) of eltrombopag once daily for 14 days.

group.title: Eltrombopag 25 mg
group.description: Participants received 25 mg of eltrombopag once daily for 14 days. Participants with a platelet count <80 x 10^9/Liter on Day 15 received eltrombopag for an additional week if the participant agreed to it and the investigator considered it appropriate.

group.title: Eltrombopag 37.5 mg
group.description: Participants received 37.5 mg of eltrombopag once daily for 14 days. Participants with a platelet count <80 x 10^9/Liter on Day 15 received eltrombopag for an additional week if the participant agreed to it and the investigator considered it appropriate.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Platelet Counts on Day 15 by Child-Pugh Class
measure.description: Change from Baseline was calculated as the Day 15 value minus the Baseline value. The Child-Pugh (CP) score (ranging from 5 to 15, with 5 being mild and 15 being severe), calculated based on total bilirubin, serum albumin, international normalized ratio, ascites, and hepatic encephalopathy, is used to assess the severity of liver disease. A CP score of 5 or 6 is classified as Class A (mild), a score of 7-9 is classified as Class B (moderate), and a score >=10 is classified as Class C (severe). Participants with a CP score <10 were enrolled in the study.
measure.population: FAS. The number of participants categorized as Class A or Class B is given in the category titles.

outcome.description: Change from Baseline was calculated as the Day 15 value minus the Baseline value. The numbers of females and males in each treatment group are illustrated by the "n's" in the category titles.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Platelet Counts on Day 15 by Age

outcome.title: Log-transformed Cmax on Days 14 and 15 in Participants Receiving Eltrombopag 12.5 mg
outcome.description: Serial PK samples were collected over a 24-hour (h) period on Days 14 and 15 in participants receiving eltrombopag 12.5 mg. A total of 8 blood samples (3 milliliters per sample) were collected at pre-dose, and at 1 h, 2 h, 4 h, 6 h, 8 h, 10 h, and 24 h post-dose. Cmax=maximum drug concentration.
outcome.population: PK Parameter Population: all participants from whom a PK sample was obtained and analyzed and whose PK parameter data was evaluated. One of the 12 participants took a prohibited medication that might have decreased the absorption of eltrombopag during the treatment period and was hence excluded from the PK Parameter Population.

group.title: Eltrombopag 12.5 mg
group.description: Participants received 12.5 milligrams (mg) of eltrombopag once daily for 14 days.

measure.title: Log-transformed Cmax on Days 14 and 15 in Participants Receiving Eltrombopag 12.5 mg
measure.description: Serial PK samples were collected over a 24-hour (h) period on Days 14 and 15 in participants receiving eltrombopag 12.5 mg. A total of 8 blood samples (3 milliliters per sample) were collected at pre-dose, and at 1 h, 2 h, 4 h, 6 h, 8 h, 10 h, and 24 h post-dose. Cmax=maximum drug concentration.
measure.population: PK Parameter Population: all participants from whom a PK sample was obtained and analyzed and whose PK parameter data was evaluated. One of the 12 participants took a prohibited medication that might have decreased the absorption of eltrombopag during the treatment period and was hence excluded from the PK Parameter Population.

outcome.title: Log-transformed Tmax on Days 14 and 15 in Participants Receiving Eltrombopag 12.5 mg
outcome.description: Serial PK samples were collected over a 24-hour (h) period on Days 14 and 15 in participants receiving eltrombopag 12.5 mg. A total of 8 blood samples (3 milliliters per sample) were collected at pre-dose, and at 1 h, 2 h, 4 h, 6 h, 8 h, 10 h, and 24 h post-dose. Tmax=maximum drug concentration time.

group.title: Eltrombopag 12.5 mg
group.description: Participants received 12.5 milligrams (mg) of eltrombopag once daily for 14 days.

measure.title: Log-transformed Tmax on Days 14 and 15 in Participants Receiving Eltrombopag 12.5 mg
measure.description: Serial PK samples were collected over a 24-hour (h) period on Days 14 and 15 in participants receiving eltrombopag 12.5 mg. A total of 8 blood samples (3 milliliters per sample) were collected at pre-dose, and at 1 h, 2 h, 4 h, 6 h, 8 h, 10 h, and 24 h post-dose. Tmax=maximum drug concentration time.

outcome.title: Log-transformed AUC(0-t) and AUC(0-24) on Days 14 and 15 in Participants Receiving Eltrombopag 12.5 mg
outcome.description: Serial PK samples were collected over a 24-hour (h) period on Days 14 and 15 in participants receiving eltrombopag 12.5 mg. A total of 8 blood samples (3 milliliters per sample) were collected at pre-dose, and at 1 h, 2 h, 4 h, 6 h, 8 h, 10 h, and 24 h post-dose. AUC(0-t)=area under the concentration-time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to last time of quantifiable concentration, and AUC(0-24)=area under the concentration-time curve from 0 (pre-dose) to 24 hours.

group.title: Eltrombopag 12.5 mg
group.description: Participants received 12.5 milligrams (mg) of eltrombopag once daily for 14 days.

measure.title: Log-transformed AUC(0-t) and AUC(0-24) on Days 14 and 15 in Participants Receiving Eltrombopag 12.5 mg
measure.description: Serial PK samples were collected over a 24-hour (h) period on Days 14 and 15 in participants receiving eltrombopag 12.5 mg. A total of 8 blood samples (3 milliliters per sample) were collected at pre-dose, and at 1 h, 2 h, 4 h, 6 h, 8 h, 10 h, and 24 h post-dose. AUC(0-t)=area under the concentration-time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to last time of quantifiable concentration, and AUC(0-24)=area under the concentration-time curve from 0 (pre-dose) to 24 hours.

reported_events.time_frame: The time period of detecting adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs) was from the start of eltrombopag (Day 1) treatment to 15 days post-treatment.

group.title: Eltrombopag 12.5 mg
group.description: Participants received 12.5 milligrams (mg) of eltrombopag once daily for 14 days.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
